GovernmentTypes.name: Autocracy
GovernmentTypes.description: Rule by a single person with absolute power, whose authority typically derives from military strength or claims of divine right.

GovernmentTypes.name: Technocracy
GovernmentTypes.description: Government by technical experts who make decisions based on specialized knowledge rather than public opinion.

GovernmentTypes.name: Oligarchy
GovernmentTypes.description: Rule by a small group of powerful individuals who control wealth, resources, or key industries.

GovernmentTypes.name: Democracy
GovernmentTypes.description: System where power ultimately rests with citizens who vote directly on legislation or elect representatives.

GovernmentTypes.name: Theocracy
GovernmentTypes.description: Rule by religious authorities who govern according to divine mandate or sacred texts.

GovernmentTypes.name: Plutocracy
GovernmentTypes.description: Government controlled by the wealthy, where political power correlates directly with economic power.

GovernmentTypes.name: Meritocracy
GovernmentTypes.description: System where advancement is based on demonstrated ability and achievement rather than wealth or heritage.

GovernmentTypes.name: Federation
GovernmentTypes.description: Union of partially self-governing states under a central government, balancing local autonomy with collective security.

GovernmentTypes.name: Corporatocracy
GovernmentTypes.description: Government controlled by corporate entities, where business interests dictate policy and law.

GovernmentTypes.name: AI Directorate
GovernmentTypes.description: Society governed by artificial intelligence that makes decisions based on algorithms and data analysis.

GovernmentTypes.name: Hive Mind
GovernmentTypes.description: Collective consciousness where individuals share thoughts and operate as components of a unified entity.

GovernmentTypes.name: Military Junta
GovernmentTypes.description: Rule by a committee of military leaders who seize power through force, often temporarily but sometimes enduring.

GovernmentTypes.name: Feudal Monarchy
GovernmentTypes.description: Hierarchical system with a monarch at the top and vassals who owe loyalty in exchange for land and protection.

GovernmentTypes.name: Magocracy
GovernmentTypes.description: Rule by the most powerful magic users, where arcane ability determines social standing and authority.

GovernmentTypes.name: Tribal Council
GovernmentTypes.description: Government by elders or representatives from family groups who make decisions through consensus.

GovernmentTypes.name: Anarcho-Syndicalism
GovernmentTypes.description: Self-management of collectives where workers control the means of production without centralized authority.

GovernmentTypes.name: Stratocracy
GovernmentTypes.description: Military-controlled state where civil and military leadership are unified and citizenship equals military service.

GovernmentTypes.name: Gerontocracy
GovernmentTypes.description: Rule by the elderly, valuing wisdom and experience above other qualities.

GovernmentTypes.name: Ecocracy
GovernmentTypes.description: Government prioritizing environmental concerns and sustainable practices in all decision-making.

GovernmentTypes.name: Noocracy
GovernmentTypes.description: System governed by the wise, where intelligence and rational thinking are the primary criteria for leadership.

GovernmentTypes.name: Kritarchy
GovernmentTypes.description: Rule by judges who interpret and enforce a legal code or sacred text rather than creating new laws.

GovernmentTypes.name: Constitutional Monarchy
GovernmentTypes.description: System combining hereditary rule with democratic institutions, where the monarch serves as head of state with limited powers.

GovernmentTypes.name: Demarchive
GovernmentTypes.description: Government by randomly selected citizens who serve terms before returning to private life.

GovernmentTypes.name: Geniocracy
GovernmentTypes.description: Rule by geniuses, where intelligence tests determine eligibility for leadership positions.

GovernmentTypes.name: Necrocracy
GovernmentTypes.description: Government officially ruled by a deceased figure, with living officials claiming to interpret their will.

GovernmentTypes.name: Biocracy
GovernmentTypes.description: Rule by biological or genetic superiority, where leadership is determined by physical traits or bloodlines.

GovernmentTypes.name: Post-Scarcity Collective
GovernmentTypes.description: Society where abundance eliminates traditional economic concerns, governed through voluntary association.

GovernmentTypes.name: Kleptocracy
GovernmentTypes.description: Rule by thieves, where corruption and embezzlement of public funds are institutionalized.

GovernmentTypes.name: Astrological Regency
GovernmentTypes.description: Government guided by celestial omens, where planetary movements determine policy and leadership changes.

GovernmentTypes.name: Virtual Democracy
GovernmentTypes.description: System where citizens vote continuously through digital platforms on all matters of governance.
